src/math/vector.js

General vector mathematics using arrays.

▸ divide

Divide a vector by a scalar. A division can be defined as an inversed multiplication.

divide
Parameters
vector ([Array<number>](default []))
scalar ([number](default 1))
Returns
Array<number>: resulting vector
▸ dot

Calculate the dot product that is a single number between two vectors. The dot product is directly related to the cosine of the angle between two vectors in Euclidean space of any number of dimensions (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_product).

Unlike the mathematical definition this method does ignore different cardinalities of the given vectors and fills differences with zero.

dot
Parameters
vector1 ([Array<number>](default []))
vector2 ([Array<number>](default []))
Returns
number: resulting dot product
▸ magnitude

Calculate the magnitude of a vector. The magnitude is equivalent to the square root of the dot product of the vector by itself. Geometrically, a vector can be described as an arrow from the origin of the space (vector tail) to a point (vector tip). The magnitude is the distance between its tail and its tip (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnitude_(mathematics)#Euclidean_vector_space).

magnitude
Parameters
vector (Array<number>)
Returns
number: magnitude
▸ normalize

Normalize a vector (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_vector).

normalize
Parameters
vector (Array<number>)
Returns
Array<number>: normalized vector with its magnitude=0

svg/dom

src/svg/dom/index.js

Hierarchical modelling, modification and parsing of DOM-Elements using objects.

svg/dom
Static Members
▸ standardizeAttributes

Standardize and transform element attributes to objects that are given with a different type. Primitive values will be wrapped to them as corresponding key and an empty string value.

standardizeAttributes
Parameters
attributes ((string | Array<string> | number | Array<number> | Object))
Returns
Object: standardized attributes
▸ createElement

Create a valid DOM-Element that is represented as an object with a tag, attributes and an array containing child elements. Attributes are represented as an object, but can also be passed as a string, number or array. Those are escaped to an object with them as key and an empty string as the attribute. (@see .standardizeAttributes()) The returning element is wrapped in an array. This behavior ensures easy modifiability when adding more elements to the hierarchy. When passing nested children, redundant square brackets (only on the second level) will be automatically removed.

createElement
Parameters
tag (string) A tag that defines the DOM-Element that cannot be omitted. Otherwise, an empty array will be returned.
attributes ([(string | Array<string> | number | Array<number> | Object)] (default {}) )
children ([(string | Array<string> | number | Array<number> | Object | Array<Object>)](default []))
Returns
Array<Object>: An array containing an object that represents the DOM-Element.
▸ appendAt

Append one or multiple element(s) to the children of a parent element at an specified index. The children elements can be passed as a single object or as an array containing multiple objects that represent elements. It is also possible to pass a primitive (string, number) or an array of primitives as children. The parent element can also be passed with or without square brackets, so it is easier to reference to a specific element inside a complex hierarchy. (@see createElement/.createElement())

appendAt
Parameters
parent ((Object | Array<Object>)) A parent element to that the children are attached that cannot be omitted. Otherwise, an empty array will be returned.
element ([(string | Array<string> | number | Array<number> | Object | Array<Object>)] (default []) ) A single element or elements that are going to be attached to the children.
index ([Number] (default 0) ) The index at which children are inserted.
Returns
Array<Object>: An array containing the parent element with attached children.
▸ prepend

Append one or multiple element(s) to the beginning of the children of a parent element. (@see .appendAt())

prepend
Parameters
parent ((Object | Array<Object>)) A parent element to that the children are attached that cannot be omitted. Otherwise, an empty array will be returned.
element ([(string | Array<string> | number | Array<number> | Object | Array<Object>)] (default []) ) A single element or elements that are going to be attached to the beginning of the children.
Returns
Array<Object>: An array containing the parent element with attached children at the beginning.
▸ append

Append one or multiple element(s) to the end of the children of a parent element. (@see .appendAt())

append
Parameters
parent ((Object | Array<Object>)) A parent element to that the children are attached that cannot be omitted. Otherwise, an empty array will be returned.
element ([(string | Array<string> | number | Array<number> | Object | Array<Object>)] (default []) ) A single element or elements that are going to be attached to the end of the children.
Returns
Array<Object>: An array containing the parent element with attached children at the end.
